node.title: Blind drag racer has a lesson about following your dreams
node.description: I chose this week's story mainly for an audience of one â€” Ted, my nephew who says his blindness sometimes feels insurmountable.
node.content: ["I chose this week's story mainly for an audience of one \u2014 Ted, my 12-year-old nephew who says his blindness sometimes feels insurmountable.\u00a0", "\"I thought, like, I was doomed. Although that does sound a little immature,\" Ted told CBS News. \"I really want to be like\u00a0everybody sometimes.\"\u00a0", "And that's why, when I heard about a drag racer attempting to set a new world speed record, I thought Ted and others like him had to meet the driver, Dan Parker.\u00a0", "In 2012, Parker, of Columbus, Georgia, was in a crash and suffered a traumatic brain injury so severe it blinded him.", "\"I never imagined I'd be back in the seat of a race car. But I've been a racer my whole life, I just had to figure out another way to do it,\" Parker told CBS News.\u00a0", "A machinist by trade, Parker got adaptive equipment so he could make parts and then designed an entire race car.", "Last week, Parker and his crew \u2014 along with supporters from the National Federation of the Blind and Cruise, an autonomous vehicle company \u2014 traveled to Spaceport America in southern New Mexico to attempt a Guinness record \u2014 fastest car driven blindfolded.\u00a0", "Of course, no blindfold was necessary. But he did have a special audio guidance system and, for safety purposes, a sighted driver next to him with hands hovering over the steering wheel, just in case.\u00a0", "It wasn't necessary. Parker went 211 miles per hour, setting a record and, more importantly, an example.", "\"Ted, I want you to know that blindness is not what is stopping you,\" Parker recently told my nephew. \"Surround yourself with believers and go for your dreams. You can make excuses or you can make it happen.\"", "Parker says inspiring people like Ted is the main reason he did this. If my nephew is any indication, it was well worth the drive.\u00a0", "\"If he can do that,\" Ted said, \"Well then I think I could easily pursue my dream.\"", "Parker's record-attempt was part of the National Federation of\u00a0the Blind's \"Blind Driver Challenge,\" which seeks to draw attention to the need for accessible technology that will improve mobility and transportation independence for blind people through autonomous vehicles.", "To contact\u00a0On the Road, or to send us a story idea, email us:\u00a0OnTheRoad@cbsnews.com.\u00a0 \u00a0", "Steve Hartman has been a CBS News correspondent since 1998, having served as a part-time correspondent for the previous two years."]
